titleStmt.title: Evangelion Aprakos (Gospel lectionary), fragment, archive No. A787a21, 15th c.
titleStmt.author: Dilyana Radoslavova

availability.p: The intellectual content of this file is copyrighted by the creators under the Creative Commons Attribution-No Derivative Works 3.0 under legislation in Bulgaria. In short, you could download and disseminate information, but you are not allowed to alter, transform, or build upon the works on this section of the site. All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://www.ilit.bas.bg/repertorium/

prefixDef.p: In the context of this project, private URIs with the prefix "bib" point to bibl elements in the project's bib.xml file.

support.material: Parchment of fine quality. Ff. 1r-2v is the hair side of the sheet and ff. 1v-2r are its slesh side, respectively.

supportDesc.condition: It is a fragment of bifolim. The text is partially preserved. Much of the sheet had been cut away, so that columns 1b, c and 2 b, c were cut lengthwise and contain only 8-10 letters per line. Ff. 1r-2v are printed red in the fashion typical of Martinus Aschaneus' library. Strips of paper have been pasted over the upper and lower margins, covering part of the text in the upper lines of f. 1r and the three uppermost lines of 2v. The leaves have been folded in about 3.5 im to make them fit as a cover. Paste has dissolved the ink of the letters, leaving an impression of them both in the upper and lower margins and in the text itself on ff. 1v and 2r. There is a tear in the parchment from column 2a toward 2d and the little lap from the hole has been folded back and has fastened to the other side. There holes from binding in the back.

physDesc.ink: Brownish for the text, red for the headings and the initials.

decoDesc.p: Ornamented red geometrical initial В with vegetal motifs, 4 lines (40 mm) of height on f. 1ra, and red geometrical initial Р of the same height on f. 2rb

binding.p: Kept together with other parchment fragments (A787a)

additions.note: The figure 9 is written in the crease along the back.

msContents.summary: The fragment contains running text of Matthew 9.41, Luke 14.1-11, 18.18-30, and Matthew 9.42-49 with some lacunae in the outer columns.

sampleText.p: амıнь г҃лю вамъ, не погоубить мъзды своѥѧ

acquisition.note: The fragment was used for binding in Martinus Aschaneus' library.

source.p: Directly catalogued from the original manuscript using the printed catalogue from ...
